metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5002 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Adobe Flash Player versions 29.0.0.171 and earlier have a Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5002` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 30.0.0.113ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 30.0.0.113ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '30.0.0.113ubuntu0.14.04.1').
